Trial_Design.evidence: An institutional review board-approved, multicenter clinical trial

Participants.evidence: Patients with a single focus of IDC 20 mm or smaller by pre-ablation MRI were treated with PLA.

Intervention.evidence: Patients with a single focus of IDC 20 mm or smaller by pre-ablation MRI were treated with PLA.

Objective.evidence: to determine the efficacy and outcome of percutaneous laser ablation (PLA) in the treatment of invasive ductal breast carcinoma (IDC).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The patients underwent a 28-day post-ablation MRI, followed by surgical resection.

Number_Randomised.evidence: In this study, 61 patients were reported as the intention-to-treat cohort

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of these 61 patients, 51 (84%) had complete tumor ablation confirmed by pathology analysis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The negative predictive value (NPV) of MRI for all the patients was 92.2% (95% confidence interval [CI], 71.9–91.9%).
